identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study to Investigate ANS014004 in Participants With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 1 Study Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Preliminary Efficacy of ANS014004 as a Single Agent in Participants With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a Phase 1, first-in-human, open-label, multi-center study with the aim of exploring the safety, tolerability, PK, and preliminary anti-tumor activity of ANS014004 as a single agent in participants with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumors.

conditions: Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors

armGroups.label: ANS014004 Monotherapy
armGroups.description:
Part 1 aims to determine the safety, tolerability, maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and/or recommended phase 2 dose (RP2D) of ANS014004.

Part 2 aims to determine the safety, tolerability and evaluate anti-tumor activity of ANS014004 as monotherapy in select solid tumors.

primaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients with adverse events by system organ class and preferred term
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the time of first dose to 28 days post last dose of ANS014004

primaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients with serious adverse events by system organ class and preferred term
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From time of first dose to 28 days post last dose of ANS014004

primaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of dose-limiting toxicities (DLT) as defined in the protocol
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients with at least 1 dose-limiting toxicity (DLT), which is any toxicity defined as a DLT in the Clinical Study Protocol
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From time of first dose of ANS014004 to end of DLT period (approximately 30 days)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of baseline laboratory finding, ECG and vital signs changes
primaryOutcomes.description: measured by laboratory and vital sign variables over time including change from
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From time of first dose to 28 days post last dose of ANS014004

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with radiological response (ORR)
primaryOutcomes.description: Assessed by overall response rate (ORR) defined as the proportion of patients who have a confirmed complete or partial radiological response by the Investigator according to RECIST v1.1
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of first dose of ANS014004 until progression, or the last evaluable assessment in the absence of progression （approximately 2 years)）

secondaryOutcomes.description: The percentage or number of patients with a confirmed investigator assessed complete or partial response according to response criteria in solid tumours (RECIST v1.1)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of first dose of ANS014004 up until progression, or the last evaluable assessment in the absence of progression (approximately 2 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: The percentage of patients with confirmed CR or PR or having SD maintained (RECIST v1.1)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of first dose of ANS014004 up until progression, or the last evaluable assessment in the absence of progression (approximately 2 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: From date of first dose of ANS014004 up until progression, or the last evaluable assessment in the absence of progression
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of first dose of ANS014004 up until progression, or the last evaluable assessment in the absence of progression (approximately 2 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: The time from first dose until RECIST 1.1 defined disease progression or death due to any cause
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: rom date of first dose of ANS014004 up until date of progression or death due to any cause (approximately 2 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: The time from the date of the first dose of study treatment until death due to any cause
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of first dose of ANS014004 up until the date of death due to any cause (approximately 2 years)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ANS014004: Plasma PK concentrations
secondaryOutcomes.description: Measurement of plasma concentrations of ANS014004, total antibody and total unconjugated warhead
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of first dose up until 28 days post last dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ANS014004: Area under the concentration time curve (AUC)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Measurement of PK parameters: Area under the concentration time curve (AUC)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of first dose up until 28 days post last dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ANS014004: Maximum plasma concentration of the study drug (C-max)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Measurement of PK parameters: Maximum observed plasma concentration of the study drug (C-max)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of first dose up until 28 days post last dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ANS014004: Time to maximum plasma concentration of the study drug (T-max)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Measurement of PK parameters: Time to maximum observed plasma concentration of the study drug (T-max)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of first dose up until 28 days post last dose

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measurement of PK parameters: the volume of plasma from which the study drug is completely removed per unit time (Clearance)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of first dose up until 28 days post last dose

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measurement of PK parameters: Terminal elimination half-life (t 1/2)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of first dose up until 28 days post last dose

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age ≥ 18 years
* Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status: 0-1
* Life expectancy ≥ 12 weeks
* Measurable disease per RECIST v1.1
* Adequate organ and marrow function as defined in the protocol
* With a pathogenetic MET alteration (including MET mutation, MET amplification, MET overexpression, MET fusion)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Active infection including tuberculosis and HBV, HCV or HIV
* Known active or untreated CNS metastases
* Participants with carcinomatous meningitis or meningeal metastases, or spinal cord compression
* Participants with serious cardiovascular or cerebrovascular diseases

locations.facility: The University of Texas - MD Anderson Cancer Center
